article.description: Vernon Teel and Anthony Ireland scored 14 points each Saturday night to lead Loyola Marymount to a 67-48 victory over Cal Poly-San Luis Obispo.
article.headline: Vernon Teel, Anthony Ireland lead Loyola Marymount to victory
article.linkText: Teel, Ireland lead Loyola Marymount to victory
article.story: LOS ANGELES -- Vernon Teel and Anthony Ireland scored 14 points each Saturday night to lead Loyola Marymount to a 67-48 victory over Cal Poly-San Luis Obispo. Ashley Hamilton had 12 points and LaRon Armstead scored 11 for the Lions (4-5), who avenged a 55-48 loss to the Mustangs at San Luis Obispo on Nov. 24. Teel, Hamilton and Godwin Okonji had eight rebounds apiece as the Lions owned a 39-23 advantage on the boards. Loyola only committed six turnovers, never trailed and the final margin was their largest of the night. Maliik Love scored 16 points to lead Cal Poly (3-4). Shawn Lewis added 13.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
